title: Competency-Enhancement Program Based on Situated Learning for Medical Students' Professional Development and Identity Formation

context.prior_knowledge: Basic Medical Theory and Clinical Practice Experience
context.additional_context: Aims to foster professional identity formation and internalization of medical ethics through small-group activities and field practice

learning_goals: Learners can understand and explain over 85% of core concepts in medical professionalism through small-group discussions and case analyses over six weeks
Learners can analyze three or more observed physician-patient interaction cases through role model shadowing activities and concretize their own clinical philosophy
Learners can document and present five or more cases of applying 'noble values' (e.g., patient respect, social responsibility) to actual clinical situations during four field practicums
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
